cyclone.name: FRED
cyclone.current_location: about 235 miles south of Panama City, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: moving north-northwest across the eastern Gulf of Mexico, then turning northward toward the western Florida Panhandle and continuing inland across Alabama/Georgia toward the southern Appalachians
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: western Florida Panhandle (near or east of Panama City)
cyclone.hours_to_offshore: N/A (system expected to remain inland and dissipate before reaching the Delaware coast)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Storm Surge Watch/Warning and Tropical-Storm-Force Watches limited to Florida Panhandle coastline only
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical Storm Warning from Navarre FL to the Wakulla/Jefferson County line; Storm-Surge Warning Indian Pass to Yankeetown FL
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Gulf Coast (western Florida Panhandle, Alabama coast) and inland areas of AL/GA/Carolinas
weather_observation.closest_wind_data_location: None listed (Wilmington, DE not in probability table)
weather_observation.wind: Breezy conditions possible mid-week with gusts generally below tropical-storm strength (20–30 mph).
weather_observation.rainfall: Remnant moisture could bring 1–3 inches of rain to the Delaware Valley Wednesday into Thursday with pockets of heavier showers.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Low-end risk of isolated brief tornadoes inland if remnants track nearby; possible minor river rises but no significant flooding forecast.
